<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" media="screen" href="/~d/styles/rss2full.xsl"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/css" media="screen" href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~d/styles/itemcontent.css"?><rss xmlns:itunes="http://www.itunes.com/dtds/podcast-1.0.dtd" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:taxo="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/taxonomy/" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:wfw="http://wellformedweb.org/CommentAPI/" xmlns:feedburner="http://rssnamespace.org/feedburner/ext/1.0" version="2.0"><channel><title>Deadspin</title><link>http://deadspin.com</link><description>Sports News without Access, Favor, or Discretion</description><language>en</language><atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" href="http://feeds.gawker.com/deadspin/full" /><feedburner:info uri="deadspin/full" /><atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="hub" href="http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/" /><feedburner:browserFriendly>This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.</feedburner:browserFriendly><item><title>So You Want To Be A Rock 'N' Roll Star, Then Listen Now To What I Say</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/65IIulgJOUQ/so-you-want-to-be-a-rock-n-roll-star-well-listen-now-t-1776417047</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--h498B7Np--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/j0rzq5yi7gk1n1rfyuim.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Meghan Trainor appeared on The Tonight Show tonight to sing whatever song she’s selling now, and the performance ended with a bang, you might say.</p><p><a href="http://screengrabber.deadspin.com/so-you-want-to-be-a-rock-n-roll-star-well-listen-now-t-1776417047">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/65IIulgJOUQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">oops</category><category domain="">tonight show</category><category domain="">meghan trainor</category><category domain="">falls</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 05:04:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776417047</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Timothy Burke on Screengrabber, shared by Timothy Burke to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://screengrabber.deadspin.com/so-you-want-to-be-a-rock-n-roll-star-well-listen-now-t-1776417047</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>A Good Cat Got Loose On The Field At The Angels Game</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/bnnlGDtpMKQ/a-good-cat-got-loose-on-the-field-at-the-angels-game-1776410016</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--YsAx9CcM--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/fbqrvwal3wydyjoj4jlc.jpg" /><p class="first-text">A nice cat escaped from somewhere and got onto the field at the Angels game this evening, ran around a bunch, leapt a wall, and ran through hundreds of bemused fans. The best part of this video is watching the reactions of cascading sections of fans as our friend here made his break for freedom.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/a-good-cat-got-loose-on-the-field-at-the-angels-game-1776410016">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/bnnlGDtpMKQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">whimsy</category><category domain="">los angeles angels</category><category domain="">cats</category><category domain="">idiot on the field</category><category domain="">baseball</category><category domain="">mlb</category><category domain="">good cats</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:51:40 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776410016</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/a-good-cat-got-loose-on-the-field-at-the-angels-game-1776410016</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Kevin Durant Is Still The Shit</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/pgUpv9vTo-4/kevin-durant-is-still-the-shit-1776407389</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--gDhYB-NP--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/f2mqf9enes6rv7sat914.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Since Steph Curry ate the NBA whole and arose as the preeminent superstar in the NBA last year, the luster on Kevin Durant has faded a little bit. The Thunder have stagnated since they made the Finals in 2012, and Durant and Russell Westbrook have only made incremental progress in learning how to enmesh their tremendous talents to produce cohesive basketball. OKC was overshadowed by Golden State and San Antonio all season long, and <a href="http://espn.go.com/nba/story/_/page/OKCSAS-15422209/experts-predictions-spurs-thunder" rel="noopener" target="_blank">most prognosticators</a> didn’t give them much of a chance of upsetting the Spurs. But after six <a href="http://deadspin.com/all-hell-broke-loose-on-that-final-play-of-thunder-spur-1774399187">weird games</a>
 <inset id="1774399187" />, they are on to face the Warriors. The Thunder needed KD to bring it, and he did, scoring 37 in one of his best games of the playoffs.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/kevin-durant-is-still-the-shit-1776407389">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/pgUpv9vTo-4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">nba playoffs</category><category domain="">nba</category><category domain="">kevin durant</category><category domain="">oklahoma city thunder</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:28:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776407389</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/kevin-durant-is-still-the-shit-1776407389</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Is This A Dick Or What?</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/SXshTH-CQ0k/is-this-a-dick-or-what-1776392136</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--z-dsfJrB--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/crgyismiygjntqivacyo.jpg" /><p class="first-text">This evening, reader Grant was looking for running shoes on Zappos when he stumbled upon what appeared to be a dong on the <a href="http://www.zappos.com/nike-flex-2016-rn-pure-platinum-white-black~1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">sole of some Nikes</a>. He <a href="http://mailto:tips@deadspin.com" rel="noopener" target="_blank">sent us a tip</a>, and he sparked a brief debate in the Deadspin newsroom. Friends, this appears to be a dick. Let’s assess.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/is-this-a-dick-or-what-1776392136">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/SXshTH-CQ0k" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">is this a dick or what</category><category domain="">dicks</category><category domain="">dongs</category><category domain="">nike</category><category domain="">running</category><category domain="">running shoes</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:45:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776392136</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/is-this-a-dick-or-what-1776392136</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Move Over Hank The Dog, There's A New Baseball Dog In Town</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/cEILEgOQPow/move-over-hank-the-dog-theres-a-new-baseball-dog-in-to-1776387612</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--ZJ3XhkmI--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/qkrxkubysyfqijidxl0j.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Hank the Dog, the Brewers’ pooch who <a href="http://deadspin.com/milwaukee-brewers-claim-that-hank-the-dog-did-not-die-a-1762910048#_ga=1.210332373.172790216.1450136263">may or may not be a hoax</a>, was the most famous dog in baseball until this week, when the Savannah Bananas found this good doggy abandoned in their stadium parking lot. Her name is Daisy and she’s extremely <a href="https://www.facebook.com/547484042073874/photos/pcb.642655085890102/642521415903469/?type=3&amp;theater" rel="noopener" target="_blank">good and handsome</a>.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/move-over-hank-the-dog-theres-a-new-baseball-dog-in-to-1776387612">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/cEILEgOQPow" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">dogs</category><category domain="">sports dog</category><category domain="">savannah bananas</category><category domain="">minor league baseball</category><category domain="">baseball</category><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776387612</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/move-over-hank-the-dog-theres-a-new-baseball-dog-in-to-1776387612</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Madden 17's Cover Star Is Rob Gronkowski</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/JuBXR7gCUnM/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--hOwz--x3--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/zfomfkmzcxlq5m0ey6v1.png" /><p class="first-text">The next cover athlete for <em>Madden</em> will be Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski, EA announced this evening. Given that the Xbox Store leaked this news earlier today, the only real shock here is that he’s wearing a shirt.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/JuBXR7gCUnM" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">madden</category><category domain="">madden 17</category><category domain="">kotakucore</category><category domain="">ea</category><category domain="">electronic arts</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:05:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776357690</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jason Schreier on Kotaku, shared by Patrick Redford to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/madden-17s-cover-star-is-rob-gronkowski-1776357690</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>An Alaskan High School Football Player Let The Results Of A Bear Hunt Decide Where He'd Play In College</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/4wKjJpLhFSk/an-alaskan-college-football-player-let-the-results-of-a-1776373532</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--PCKURDqi--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ycdblv77nky75s4vafml.jpg" /><p class="first-text">What’s your process for making a really tough decision? Do you flip a coin? Consult the wisdom of your parents? Maybe you <a href="http://lifehacker.com/four-tricks-to-help-you-make-any-difficult-decision-987762341" rel="noopener" target="_blank">make a spreadsheet</a>
 <inset id="987762341" />. Chase Ferris of Palmer, Alaska had to decide between playing college football for the University of Mary or attending the University of Wyoming. So he went on a bear hunt and let his future hinge on whether or not he could kill the bear. Dead bear = football. Bear escapes = no football. From the <em><a href="http://www.frontiersman.com/sports/palmer-senior-chases-his-football-destiny/article_2d68b6e0-133c-11e6-85fe-f74c28d6b8f5.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Mat-Su Valley Frontiersman</a></em>:</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/an-alaskan-college-football-player-let-the-results-of-a-1776373532">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/4wKjJpLhFSk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">college football</category><category domain="">alaska</category><category domain="">hunting</category><category domain="">bears</category><category domain="">university of mary</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:27:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776373532</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/an-alaskan-college-football-player-let-the-results-of-a-1776373532</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>How To Cook A Delicious Meal With Your Car</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/3KM4sZYSHng/how-to-cook-a-delicious-meal-with-your-car-1775720726</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--xbDJvF7F--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/xkx8x2qfpbrwg0hwky54.png" /><p class="first-text">Your car’s gasoline engine wastes two thirds of its fuel’s energy as heat, so why not harness that energy and cook a delicious meal? It’s fun and easy, and you can do it too. <br /></p><p><a href="http://jalopnik.com/how-to-cook-a-delicious-meal-with-your-car-1775720726">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/3KM4sZYSHng" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">car cooking</category><category domain="">project swiss cheese</category><category domain="">jeep</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:03:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1775720726</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[David Tracy on Jalopnik, shared by Patrick Redford to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://jalopnik.com/how-to-cook-a-delicious-meal-with-your-car-1775720726</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Can Tom Dumoulin Become The Most Unlikely Giro d'Italia Winner Of His Generation? </title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/uej90lK4uaQ/can-tom-dumoulin-become-the-most-unlikely-giro-ditalia-1776286499</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--G8Ndxcya--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/l2vjo7lkcowsky2ymp4c.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Cycling’s three-week Grand Tours are a sort of long, slowly unfolding lesson in the truth of Mike Tyson’s prophecy about how everyone has a plan until they get punched in the mouth. Every nine-man team charts out how they want their race to go, but 21-stage races are so chaotic that most get dashed to bits rather quickly. Sometimes you get disappointments, like when <a href="http://deadspin.com/this-year-everyone-at-the-tour-de-france-is-crashing-o-1607241487" rel="noopener" target="_blank">everyone crashed out of the 2014 Tour</a>
 <inset id="1607241487" /> and sometimes you get fantastic historical quirks, like when <a href="http://velonews.competitor.com/2013/09/news/horner-makes-grand-tour-history-on-ideal-vuelta-course_302951" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Chris Horner won the 2013 Vuelta</a> at age 41.</p><p><a href="http://fittish.deadspin.com/can-tom-dumoulin-become-the-most-unlikely-giro-ditalia-1776286499">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/uej90lK4uaQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">bikespin</category><category domain="">cycling</category><category domain="">giro ditalia</category><category domain="">tom dumoulin</category><category domain="">vincenzo nibali</category><category domain="">racing</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776286499</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patrick Redford on Fittish, shared by Patrick Redford to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://fittish.deadspin.com/can-tom-dumoulin-become-the-most-unlikely-giro-ditalia-1776286499</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Deadspin Up All Night: How Bad Did He Bite Her</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/yWLHHY3Dw1o/deadspin-up-all-night-how-bad-did-he-bite-her-1776361723</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--4_dtQuUZ--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ttnks4uag652jr6sgows.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Thank you for your continued support of Deadspin. Yeesh.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/deadspin-up-all-night-how-bad-did-he-bite-her-1776361723">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/yWLHHY3Dw1o" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">duan</category><category domain="">deadspin up all night</category><category domain="">metapost</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:24:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776361723</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Billy Haisley]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/deadspin-up-all-night-how-bad-did-he-bite-her-1776361723</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The Fallout 4 Survival Permadeath Run That Turned Preston Garvey Into A Monster</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/9n-0HpWLPew/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--czI8PwIL--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/yqyl3jany6vud8nkth6q.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Most players attempting <em>Fallout 4’</em>s Survival mode will just get their ass kicked. One player, however, has already managed to beat the entire thing on a single life. Funnily enough, the toughest challenge Kyle Hinckley faced along the way wasn’t something like starvation or damage, but rather a nearly catastrophic glitch.<br /></p><p><a href="http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/9n-0HpWLPew" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">fallout</category><category domain="">fallout 4</category><category domain="">bethesda</category><category domain="">permadeath</category><category domain="">watch this</category><category domain="">youtube</category><category domain="">kotaku core</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776289180</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Patricia Hernandez on Kotaku, shared by Tim Marchman to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kotaku.com/the-fallout-4-survival-permadeath-run-that-turned-prest-1776289180</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Today's Best Deals: Free href="http://www.amazon.com/Pyrex-8-Piece-Glass-Bakeware-Storage/dp/B004CFY55A?kinja_price=15" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Pyrex dishes</a>, and a <a href="http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00Q2B5KY2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">clever USB battery pack</a> lead off Thursday’s best deals.</p><p><a href="http://deals.kinja.com/todays-best-deals-free-hdtv-pyrex-dishes-bluetooth-h-1776234799">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/_JTL0n4qc-g" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">kinja deals</category><category Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deals.kinja.com/todays-best-deals-free-hdtv-pyrex-dishes-bluetooth-h-1776234799</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Truck Yeah Your Next Pickup Truck Will Be A Car | Two Cents Why Walmart Is Suing Visa, and What It M</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/re9mwcCBm94/truck-yeah-your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-two-c-1776347196</link><description><p class="first-text"><strong>Truck Yeah</strong> <a href="http://truckyeah.jalopnik.com/your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-1776145082?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener"  <inset id="1776145082" /> | <strong>Two Cents</strong> <a href="http://twocents.lifehacker.com/why-walmart-is-suing-visa-and-what-it-means-for-your-c-1776087900?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Why Walmart Is Suing Visa, and What It Means for Your Credit Cards</a>
 <inset id="1776087900" /> | <strong>io9</strong> <a href="http://io9.gizmodo.com/youre-not-doing-the-time-warp-its-just-the-new-rocky-h-1776275600?utm_source=recirculation&amp;utm_medium=recirculation&amp;utm_campaign=thursdayPM" rel="noopener" target="_blank">You’re Not Doing the Time Warp, It’s Just the New <em>Rocky Horror Picture Show</em> </a>

GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776347196</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Kinja! on Kinja Roundup, shared by Barry Petchesky to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://kinjaroundup.kinja.com/truck-yeah-your-next-pickup-truck-will-be-a-car-two-c-1776347196</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>People Will Pay Crazy Amounts For Your Early Apple Products</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/jC9ZgxOI7bI/people-will-pay-crazy-amounts-for-your-early-apple-prod-1776342584</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--bkNPuQrz--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/vpjzuwmxrwt206p1tdwa.jpg" /><p class="first-text">If the proliferation of <em>Mean Girls </em>(released in 2004)<em> </em>memes on the Internet hasn’t convinced you that the nostalgia cycle is faster than ever, consider that early iPods and Apple promotional materials are now being marketed as classic collectors items—with Ebay values rivaling more traditional memorabilia from far earlier decades.<br /></p><p><a href="http://adequateman.deadspin.com/people-will-pay-crazy-amounts-for-your-early-apple-prod-1776342584">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/jC9ZgxOI7bI" probably never will again. The club plays in Spanish fourth division, though they currently are in the playoffs for promotion to the third. To support their promotion hopes, they’ve unveiled a new kit. It is ... strange.</p><p><a href="http://screamer.deadspin.com/lower-league-spanish-team-unveils-kit-that-makes-player-1776335475">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/M9QydJYDkcg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">cd palencia</category><category domain="">spain</category><category domain="">uniforms</category><category domain="">jerseys</category><category domain="">fashion</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:42:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776335475</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Billy Haisley on Screamer, shared by Billy Haisley to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://screamer.deadspin.com/lower-league-spanish-team-unveils-kit-that-makes-player-1776335475</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Serena Williams Ate Some Fancy Dog Food And Then Crapped A Bunch</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/yWayHCEgIVk/serena-williams-ate-some-fancy-dog-food-and-then-crappe-1776329771</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--9DED1Pvn--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ifmvqmkxpryuvzdlarww.jpg" /><p class="first-text">We live in wonderful times. Thanks to the miracle of technology, we are able to enjoy this first-hand account of the time world-famous tennis star Serena Williams decided to eat a spoonful of fancy dog food, which caused her to shit her brains out.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/serena-williams-ate-some-fancy-dog-food-and-then-crappe-1776329771">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/yWayHCEgIVk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">lifes rich pageant</category><category domain="">whimsy</category><category domain="">serena williams</category><category domain="">dog food</category><category domain="">crappin</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:13:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776329771</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Tom Ley]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/serena-williams-ate-some-fancy-dog-food-and-then-crappe-1776329771</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Dayton Center Steve McElvene Dies At 20</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/6XYsB7a_Niw/dayton-center-steve-mcelvene-dies-at-20-1776325750</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--HoHnSjZO--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/jcfagungff7tigbagb36.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Dayton men’s basketball player Steve McElvene reportedly died at his family’s home today. While these lack touch-free sensors, the faucet head does detach to reveal a hose, and it even reattaches magnetically for easy storage. Just note that like all Gold Box deals, these prices are only available today, or until they run dry.<br /></p><p><a Protecting Penn State And Temple? </title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/00wklclxDts/why-are-bad-laws-still-protecting-penn-state-and-temple-1775175207</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--I2sbEiTy--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/srnsiwvhxittwfshsxmr.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><a href="http://deadspin.com/psu-prez-slams-unsubstantiated-accusations-from-alleg-1775461653#_ga=1.232985054.1571226807.1408372542">The Penn State defense</a> is so well-practiced, so perfected, that by now you can practically write it yourself. <em>The accusations are unsubstantiated; too much time has passed; nobody remembers; there are no records. </em>The language changes from email to email and statement to statement as the university blasts them out to alumni and supporters, but the logic never changes:<em> The truth will never be known, so why not trust us?</em><br /></p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/why-are-bad-laws-still-protecting-penn-state-and-temple-1775175207">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/00wklclxDts" height="1" pesky war with my stomach. Have Made The Rio Olympics A Looming Disaster</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/ysPbdDF6Y_g/zika-and-a-political-crisis-have-made-the-rio-olympics-1776292924</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--lDb_MONQ--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/anvkuznzt8r44ohkxisn.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Writing in the <em><a href="http://harvardpublichealthreview.org/off-the-podium-why-rios-2016-olympic-games-must-not-proceed/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Harvard Public Health Review</a></em>, University of Ottawa professor of population health Amir Attaran makes a persuasive argument that the outbreak of the Zika virus in Brazil is so dangerous that the upcoming Rio de Janeiro Olympics—scheduled to kick off in 84 days—should be postponed, moved, or cancelled:</p><p><a href="http://fittish.deadspin.com/zika-and-a-political-crisis-have-made-the-rio-olympics-1776292924">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/ysPbdDF6Y_g" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">olympics</category><category domain="">zika virus</category><category domain="">zika</category><category domain="">dilma rousseff</category><category domain="">brazil</category><category domain="">rio de janeiro olympics</category><category domain="">2016 olympics</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:25:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776292924</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Kevin Draper on Fittish, shared by Kevin Draper to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://fittish.deadspin.com/zika-and-a-political-crisis-have-made-the-rio-olympics-1776292924</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>A Crying Jordan History Separates The Man From Meme</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/-k7YltY2gHw/a-crying-jordan-history-separates-the-man-from-meme-1776274839</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--SkzfQ_UI--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/ftixg5ooorwproylhidy.jpg" /><p class="first-text">In an all-time feat of prestige media acknowledging dumb internet, the <em>New Yorker</em>’s website has offered an <a href="http://www.newyorker.com/news/sporting-scene/how-air-jordan-became-crying-jordan" rel="noopener" target="_blank">enjoyable account </a>of the Crying Jordan meme and the famous basketball guy it happens to feature. It is partly an origin story for the teary face, this inexhaustible wellspring of humor whose pleasures only intensify over time. And it is partly theory on the coolness of Michael Jordan—an attempt to disentangle the man, the meme, and the marketing machine, all moving distinctly from one another. One of its more perceptive points:<br /></p><p><a href="http://adequateman.deadspin.com/a-crying-jordan-history-separates-the-man-from-meme-1776274839">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/-k7YltY2gHw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">crying jordan</category><category domain="">michael jordan</category><category domain="">sneakers</category><category domain="">memes</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:17:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776274839</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Giri Nathan on Adequate Man, shared by Giri Nathan to Deadspin]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://adequateman.deadspin.com/a-crying-jordan-history-separates-the-man-from-meme-1776274839</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Report: Russian Olympic Doping Program Was Comically Impressive</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/deadspin/full/~3/8KhVYkk7Hkc/report-russian-olympic-doping-program-was-comically-im-1776292302</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Igjrf-qH--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/e37hgv1bppxayuqobj1u.jpg" /><p class="first-text">For all the <a href="http://deadspin.com/wada-which-fucks-up-many-things-admits-it-fucked-up-o-1770710523">very real problems</a>
 <inset id="1770710523" /> with sports’ war on drugs and the self-serving PED scolds, I can only read <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/sports/russia-doping-sochi-olympics-2014.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">this latest report about Russia’s state-run doping</a> efforts at the Sochi Olympic Games with something resembling awe. According to a whistleblower, officials, including those from Russia’s intelligence agency, cooked up a drug cocktail to dope dozens of athletes, then surreptitiously swapped out their urine samples in the dead of night, before they could be tested.</p><p><a href="http://deadspin.com/report-russian-olympic-doping-program-was-comically-im-1776292302">Read more...</a></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/deadspin/full/~4/8KhVYkk7Hkc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">russia</category><category domain="">2014 olympics</category><category domain="">sochi olympics</category><category domain="">doping</category><category domain="">olympics</category><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:06:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1776292302</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Barry Petchesky]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://deadspin.com/report-russian-olympic-doping-program-was-comically-im-1776292302</feedburner:origLink></item></channel></rss>
